Location & Venue

Our venue, The Olde 1884 Church, is located at Lincoln Ridge Farms just 10 miles west of our home in Van Wert, Ohio. Lincoln Ridge is a local favorite for strawberry, peach, and pumpkin picking throughout the year. The Olde Church was in active use by a congregation for more than 90 years, but now serves as a dedicated wedding venue. Outside, it features a large platform with a wheelchair accessible ramp. Inside, enjoy its high ceilings, tall windows, and - in July - modern air conditioning. Both our ceremony and reception will be held at this location.

Menu & Wine

Boards of cheeses, fruits, sweets, and spreads will be at the center of each table. In addition, we will be featuring a variety of red and white wines. Try something new at every table! Our guests preferring soft drinks are welcome to a selection of sparkling juices, sodas, and, of course, ice-cold water. Guests with dietary restrictions should contact us directly so we can make accommodations. Gluten-free, vegetarian, and vegan options will be available.

Music

We are very excited to host The Background Jazz Trio. This group performs throughout the Midwest for private and corporate events, as well and many weddings each year. They are comprised of the finest jazz musicians in the region and perform jazz classics from the 1920s-60s. Samples of their performance are available here, on YouTube, and at their website. As they play, enjoy a variety of tabletop and outdoor games. We will have corn-hole, cards, and tic-tac-toe scattered throughout the venue.

Recommended Attire

Our wedding is a semiformal event. For men, we recommend chinos, khakis, or comfortable slacks paired with a button-up shirt. Neck ties are welcome, but not required. For women, we recommend a summer dress and comfortable shoes. We ask only that you not wear white, lest you face the wrath of the bride. Groomsmen will be wearing black suits, while bridesmaids will be wearing sage dresses.

Hotels & Dining

For those of our guests planning to stay overnight on either the 15th or 16th, we recommend Van Wert's Holiday Inn Express. This hotel is just an eight minute drive from the venue and is surrounded by several dining options. During your stay, be sure to visit our local favorites for breakfast and dinner: the 133 Bistro and The Edition. If you find yourself in town the night of the 15th, join us after our rehearsal dinner at Brew Nation, in Celina, Ohio.
